question: 撤回
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: If you do a <kanji>withdrawal</kanji> of something it's like you're <kanji>revolv</kanji>ing back to how things originally were. This is a <vocabulary>withdrawal</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>repeal</vocabulary>. It's <vocabulary>taking back</vocabulary> something you said previously.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own. Look out for the shortened <ja>てつ</ja>.
